Sweet and Salty Mango Lassi Recipe | Bon Appétit

To finish, Mistry suggests adding white rum, “if that’s your thing.” This recipe is on the lighter side, so if you like your lassi thicker, hold back some of the water and skip the ice.Find more of chef Preeti Mistry’s Holi party recipes here.Ingredients8 servings2Tbsp. cumin seeds½cup fresh lime juice2tsp. kala namak (black salt) or kosher salt4cups plain whole-milk yogurt130-oz. can unsweetened mango pulp (such as Swad)Mint sprigs (for serving)special equipmentA spice mill or mortar and pestlePreparationStep 1Toast cumin in a small dry skillet over medium heat, shaking pan occasionally, until slightly darkened and very fragrant, about 2 minutes. Let cool, then finely grind in spice mill or with mortar and pestle.Step 2Whisk lime juice, kala namak, and ground cumin in a small bowl until salt is dissolved. Pour into a large pitcher and add yogurt, mango pulp, and 2 cups cold water; stir until smooth. Chill until cold, at least 1 hour and up to 1 day.Step 3To serve, divide lassi among glasses filled with ice and garnish each with a mint sprig.How would you rate Sweet and Salty Mango Lassi?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangleThis is delicious. I don’t think you lose much by using ground cumin rather than toasting and grinding the seeds yourself.
